text: Ran backtest on 1.21 with the above patch. Got different results from previous runs on 1.21, The results shifted from negative to positive profit. However the profit is roughly 1/3 of the value obtained using 1.20.

text: Is the simulation supposed to delete completed bets when a non-runner / reserve is declared on uk dogs prior to the off ? Investigated a divide by zero bug of mine in a strategy which arose with a REMOVED runner that had an EXECUTION_COMPLETE order in market.blotter that predated the runner removal time - there were other runners bets also in the blotter from before the removal time. Confused about what should happen but current T&Cs say "If a non-runner or reserve runner is declared, then all bets prior to the update of the market on Betfair will be void". Never checked what happens live !

elements.text: Is the simulation supposed to delete completed bets when a non-runner / reserve is declared on uk dogs prior to the off ? Investigated a divide by zero bug of mine in a strategy which arose with a REMOVED runner that had an EXECUTION_COMPLETE order in market.blotter that predated the runner removal time - there were other runners bets also in the blotter from before the removal time. Confused about what should happen but current T&Cs say "If a non-runner or reserve runner is declared, then all bets prior to the update of the market on Betfair will be void". Never checked what happens live !

text:
No. The simulator doesn't try to apply changes about which it learns from the market stream to orders already placed. In this way it behaves in the same way as the live client. However, it will reject bet placed on runners who have already been removed.

When the market closes and profits are calculated, it will treat any orders for runners who have been removed (i.e. who are not WINNERS, PLACED or LOSERS) as having zero profit, which is the same as would happen when Betfair voided those bets.

elements.text:
No. The simulator doesn't try to apply changes about which it learns from the market stream to orders already placed. In this way it behaves in the same way as the live client. However, it will reject bet placed on runners who have already been removed.

When the market closes and profits are calculated, it will treat any orders for runners who have been removed (i.e. who are not WINNERS, PLACED or LOSERS) as having zero profit, which is the same as would happen when Betfair voided those bets.

text: Thanks <@U9JHLMZB4> - clears that up. I will need to take that into account then when looking at the orders and check the runner is still ACTIVE otherwise will have wrong picture of the current bets - of course that only works if they remove the runner before the off.
